metadata.Description: Renewable energy generated from sources located in bodies of water, such as wind farms or tidal power plants.

entities.Description: Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.

Energy generated from the wind through the use of wind turbines to produce electricity.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
Renewable energy generated from sources located in bodies of water, such as wind farms or tidal power plants.

Organizations that focus on energy issues within a specific region.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies

relations.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

relations.Subject: energy poverty indices
relations.Description: Energy poverty indices implement energy access programs to provide affordable and reliable energy services to underserved communities.

Wind energy is a sub-component of offshore renewable energy. It involves harnessing the power of wind to generate electricity using wind turbines installed offshore. Offshore wind farms are becoming increasingly popular due to their higher wind speeds and larger turbine capacities.
relations.Subject: wind energy

relations.Description: Wave energy is a sub-component of offshore renewable energy. It involves capturing the energy from ocean waves and converting it into electricity. Wave energy devices are typically installed offshore and can provide a consistent and reliable source of renewable energy.
relations.Subject: wave energy

relations.Description: Tidal energy is a sub-component of offshore renewable energy. It involves harnessing the power of tides to generate electricity. Tidal energy devices are typically installed in coastal areas with strong tidal currents, and they can provide a predictable and renewable source of energy.
relations.Subject: tidal energy

relations.Description: Ocean thermal energy is a sub-component of offshore renewable energy. It involves utilizing the temperature difference between warm surface waters and cold deep waters to generate electricity. Ocean thermal energy conversion (OTEC) systems can provide a continuous and sustainable source of power.
relations.Subject: ocean thermal energy

relations.Description: Current energy is a sub-component of offshore renewable energy. It involves harnessing the kinetic energy of ocean currents to generate electricity. Current energy devices are typically installed in areas with strong and consistent currents, and they can provide a reliable and renewable source of energy.
relations.Subject: current energy
